title: Self-Attention
concept: A visualization of the self-attention mechanism. A sentence is displayed as individual word tokens in a horizontal row. Lines of varying thickness connect words that attend to each other. The word 'cat' strongly attends to 'sat' and 'mat' (thick lines), weakly to 'the' (thin lines). Below the sentence, a Query-Key-Value diagram shows the three vectors as colored bars feeding into the attention computation. Clean, educational, immediately readable.

format.bleed: Full bleed, no borders, no frames

upper_section.what: The sentence 'The cat sat on the mat' displayed as 6 word tokens in a horizontal row

word_style.font: Monospace or clean sans-serif, medium weight

attention_lines.style: Curved arcs above the word row, varying thickness = varying attention weight

upper_section.highlight: The word 'cat' box has a coral #E07850 border to show it's the query word

lower_section.what: Query-Key-Value explanation with three colored bars
lower_section.layout: Three horizontal labeled bars stacked vertically

color_palette_summary.note: Three colors for Q/K/V — coral, gold, grey. Attention arcs in coral.

composition.eye_path: Title → word row → attention arcs (the visual payoff) → Q/K/V explanation below
composition.balance: Centered, symmetric. Upper half for the visual. Lower half for the explanation.
composition.negative_space: Between the word row and the Q/K/V section — breathing room

style_summary.technique: Clean technical diagram. Flat fills. Crisp edges. Curved attention arcs.
style_summary.influences: Jay Alammar's Illustrated Transformer, but simplified and in this palette

critical_requirements: Attention arcs MUST have varying thickness to show attention weights
The word 'cat' MUST be visually highlighted as the query word
'sat' and 'mat' connections MUST be visibly thicker than others
Q/K/V bars must use three distinct colors: coral, gold, grey
Must be readable from the back of a lecture hall — large text, clear contrast
